page.description: Reports whether or not the main Alpha Five program window is visible.
page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.ISVISIBLE() Syntax Result_Flag as L = &ltOBJECT>.ISVISIBLE() Description The &ltOBJECT>.ISVISIBLE() method applies to:
Control Panel (for &ltOBJECT> use the keyword "CONTROLPANEL")
Status Bar (for &ltOBJECT> use the keyword "STATUSBAR")
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.ISVISIBLE() method returns .T. (TRUE) if a window is visible; otherwise, it returns .F. (FALSE). Limitations Desktop applications only. Example The following example shows how to determine if a window is visible. dim ptr as P ptr = form.load("Customer Information") ptr.show() ? ptr.IsVisible() = .T. ptr.hide() ? ptr.IsVisible() = .F.
See Also Window Functions and Methods
